article.headline: Fordham 67, Quinnipiac 66
article.story: NEW YORK (AP) -- Bryant Dunston scored 20 points on Sunday and Fordham held off Quinnipiac 67-66, the Bobcats' eighth straight loss. Marcus Stout had 17 points for the Rams (7-5) and Sebastian Greene added 13. Adam Gonzalez scored 17 points for Quinnipiac (2-9), while DeMario Anderson had 15 and Chris Wehye 13. Two free throws by Greene closed an 18-9 run that gave Fordham its largest lead of the game, 53-39, with 10:53 left in the game. Dunston had eight points, including two 3-pointers, in the surge. Anderson's 3-pointer with five seconds remaining capped a comeback run that brought Quinnipiac within 67-66. Stout was fouled on the inbounds play and he missed two free throws with four seconds remaining, but Anderson missed a potential game-winning shot at the buzzer.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
